Name: Terracotta representing Horus-Dionysus
Description: Representation of Horus-Dionysus standing. In his left hand he is holding a lyre and in his right hand a large phallus, which touches the musical instrument. His only attire consists of a thick foot-length cape. The body appears covered with remnants of the white preparatory ground, and with paint in the colours salmon and black. The head is lost and the piece is hollow.
